paper_abstract: This manuscript presents a 0.5-V audio-band continuous-time Delta-Sigma modulator with a new method implementing switched-capacitor-resistor (SCR) feedback to reduce clock jitter-induced noise. An ultra-low voltage (ULV) amplifier with self-compensated CMFB loop is used to meet the stricter amplifier speed required by SCR feedback. Fabricated in a 0.13 mu m CMOS process, the modulator achieves a peak SNDR of 81.2 dB over 25-kHz signal bandwidth and consumes 625 mu W at 0.5-V supply.
paper_title: A 0.5-V 81.2 dB SNDR audio-band continuous-time Delta-Sigma modulator with SCR feedback
